Package com.example.midterm_manelespinosa.controller

Class AccountHolderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.midterm_manelespinosa.controller.AccountHolderController
@RestController public class AccountHolderController extends Object
AccountHolderController class is used to establish the routes needed in order for the account holders to be able to see their accounts,consult specific account and transfer money to other accounts

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • getBasicAccounts

      @GetMapping("/accountholder/{username}/accounts") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ACCOUNTHOLDER\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) public List<BasicAccount> getBasicAccounts(@PathVariable String username)
      This route tries to show the account holder all of his or her accounts even if they are the second owner of some of them. It has security implemented because you can only see the accounts of the username logged in.
      Parameters:
      username - : username to know the accounts that have to be shown. It is passed in the route as a path variable.
      Returns:
      List return the list of accounts that belong to the user

    • getBasicAccounts

      @GetMapping("/accountholder/{username}/accounts/{id}") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ACCOUNTHOLDER\')and authentication.principal.username.equals(username)") @ResponseStatus(OK) public BasicAccount getBasicAccounts(@PathVariable String username, @PathVariable Long id)
      This route shows a specific account of a user.Both of the following parameters are passed through path variable
      Parameters:
      username - :username to know the accounts that have to be shown. It is passed in the route as a path variable.
      id - : this id belongs to the account that has to be shown.
      Returns:
      It returns the account that has the id passed if it belongs to the username passed in the route if is the same as the user logged in and if the account exists.

    • transfer

      @PatchMapping("/accountholder/{username}/accounts/{id}/transaction/transfer") @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ACCOUNTHOLDER\')") @ResponseStatus(OK) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> transfer(@PathVariable Long id, @PathVariable String username, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid TransferBody transferBody)
      This route is used to for the account holder to transfer money from one of his accounts to another existing account inside the bank database.
      Parameters:
      id - : this id belongs to the account from which the money comes.
      username - : the username is passed through the route and has to be owner of the origin account(id). This user is the one who orders it and has to be the same user that is logged in.
      transferBody - : the transfer body is a DTO class used to know the information about the destination account id and the amount transferred.
      Returns:
      it returns a message which says that the transfer has been successfully completed.
